p: Some nonenveloped mammalian viruses, such as reoviruses, assemble in the cytosol in so-called viroplasms or viral factories into icosahedral particles consisting of three concentric layers encircling segments of genomic dsDNA ( Benavente and Martinez-Costas, 2006, Jones, 2000, Shah et al., 2017). Rotavirus seems to be the only exemption in the reovirus family, as it enters the endoplasmic reticulum to gain its outer protein shell ( Trask et al., 2012).
